definition: lit. to open a water source and reduce outflow (idiom); to increase income and save on spending/to broaden the sources of income and economize on expenditure

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: After the holidays, many are ready to take control of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 在節後，他們很多人才在生活中開始開源節流。

sentences.english: Therefore, broadening sources of income and reducing expenditure is the key.
sentences.chinese: 如何“開源節流”成爲應對危機的關鍵。

sentences.english: He created the modern American civil service and throttled patronage politics.
sentences.chinese: 他開創了美國現代公民服務型政府和開源節流式政治。

definition: to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
environmental impact assessment EIA/abbr. to 環評|环评
pinyin: huan2 jing4 ying3 xiang3 ping2 gu1

definition: out with the old and in with the new (idiom)
Huinong district of Shizuishan city 石嘴山市[Shi2 zui3 shan1 shi4], Ningxia
